The 'National Academic League' ('NAL') is a popular sport in junior high schools
(middle schools) around the United States. In participating schools, two coaches
and anywhere from at least fifteen to approximately forty students compete with
other schools in the same district. Students study math, science, geography,
world history, and language arts. In the game, students prepare presentations
about current events, and/or answer questions from any of the above listed
categories. If a championship is won, it is possible to compete all the way to a
national level. Most games are played with the two teams, judges, and coaches
meeting in person, but in the national tournament, a videoconference is set up
via satellite.
